project_core.project_description: Robust protocols and automation now enable large-scale single-cell RNA and ATAC sequencing experiments and their application on biobank and clinical cohorts. However, technical biases introduced during sample acquisition can hinder solid, reproducible results and a systematic benchmarking is required before entering large-scale data production. Here, we report the existence and extent of gene expression and chromatin accessibility artifacts introduced during sampling and identify experimental and computational solutions for their prevention. Overall design: We designed benchmarking experiments to systematically test the effect of varying processing times on single-cell transcriptome and epigenome profiles from healthy and diseased donors, while controlling for technical variability (e.g. batch effects). We isolated peripheral blood mononuclear cells from healthy donors (PBMC) and from patients affected with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL), the most common adult leukemia in the Western world. Samples were either preserved immediately (0 hours) or after 2, 4, 6, 8, 24 and 48 hours; simulating common scenarios in biobank and clinical routines. Single-cell 3`-transcript counting, full-length transcriptome and scATAC-seq were performed to monitor gene expression, RNA integrity and open chromatin variance across preservation time points.

protocol_core.protocol_description: Peripheral venous blood samples were collected by venipuncture. Blood samples were collected in ACD-tubes and stored at room temperature (RT) or 4 °C.

PBMC separation was performed using Ficoll density gradient centrifugation. For each condition, 12 ml of blood was diluted with an equal volume of pre-warmed RPMI 1640 culture medium (Lonza). The diluted blood was then carefully layered onto a Leucosep tube (Greiner Bio-One) prefilled with 15 ml
of Ficoll-Plus (GE Healthcare Biosciences AB) and centrifuged for 15 min at 800×g and RT (without acceleration and brake).

method.text: tag based single cell RNA sequencing

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: Information about the donor from which a specimen was collected.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Donor organism
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: donor_organism

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

schema_type.description: The type of the metadata schema entity.

provenance.description: Provenance information provided by the system.

human_specific.description: Fields specific to human (homo sapiens) organisms.

mouse_specific.description: Fields specific to mouse (mus musculus) organisms.

genus_species.description: The scientific binomial name for the species of the organism.

sex.description: The biological sex of the organism.
sex.example: Should be one of: male, female, mixed, or unknown.

is_living.description: Whether organism was alive at time of biomaterial collection.
is_living.example: Should be one of: yes, no, not applicable, or unknown.
is_living.guidelines: Enter yes if organism was alive at time of biomaterial collection, no if organism was dead, unknown if not known, and not applicable for ex vivo embryo.

organism_age.description: Age of organism in Age units measured since birth.
organism_age.guidelines: Enter either a single value or a range of values. Indicate a range using a hyphen.

organism_age_unit.description: The unit in which Age is expressed.

development_stage.description: A classification of the developmental stage of the organism.

diseases.description: Short description of known disease(s) of the organism.

death.description: Information about conditions of death of the organism.

familial_relationships.description: Information about other organisms related to this organism.

medical_history.description: Information about the medical history of the organism.

gestational_age.description: Gestational age of pregnancy in Gestational age units measured from the last menstrual period.
gestational_age.guidelines: To calculate, add 2 weeks to embryonic post-ovulation age. Enter either a single value or indicate a range of values using a hyphen.

gestational_age_unit.description: The unit in which Gestational age is expressed.

height.description: Height of organism in Height unit.
height.guidelines: Enter either a single value or a range of values. Indicate a range using a hyphen.

height_unit.description: The unit in which Height is expressed.

weight.description: Weight of organism in Weight unit.
weight.guidelines: Enter either a single value or a range of values. Indicate a range using a hyphen.

weight_unit.description: The unit in which Weight is expressed.

timecourse.description: Information relating to a timecourse associated with this biomaterial.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Provenance
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: provenance

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

schema_major_version.description: The major version number of the schema.

schema_minor_version.description: The minor version number of the schema.

submission_date.description: When project was first submitted to database.

submitter_id.description: ID of individual who first submitted project.

updater_id.description: ID of individual who last updated project.

accession.description: A unique accession for this entity, provided by the broker.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: biomaterial_core

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

biomaterial_id.description: A unique ID for the biomaterial.

biomaterial_name.description: A short, descriptive name for the biomaterial that need not be unique.

biomaterial_description.description: A general description of the biomaterial.

supplementary_files.description: A list of filenames of biomaterial-level supplementary files.

biosamples_accession.guidelines: Enter accession if sample has been archived. Accession can be from the DDBJ, NCBI, or EMBL-EBI and must start with SAMD, SAMN, or SAME, respectively.

insdc_sample_accession.description: An International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC) sample accession.
insdc_sample_accession.guidelines: Enter accession if sample has been archived. Accession can be from the DDBJ, NCBI, or EMBL-EBI and must start with DRS, SRS, or ERS, respecitvely.

HDBR_accession.description: A Human Developmental Biology Resource (HDBR) sample accession.
HDBR_accession.guidelines: Enter accession if sample has been obtained from the Human Developmental Biology Resource (HDBR).

ethnicity.guidelines: Enter one or more ethnicities, separated by a comma.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: Information relating to the death of an organism.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Death
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: death

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

cause_of_death.example: Hypoxic brain damage; Sudden cardiac arrest
cause_of_death.guidelines: Determined from death report for human donor or from research lab for mouse.

cold_perfused.description: Whether perfusion with cold fluid was used to help preserve tissues before heart stopped.
cold_perfused.example: Should be one of: yes, no.
cold_perfused.guidelines: Enter yes if cold perfused. Otherwise, enter no.

days_on_ventilator.description: Number of days on ventilator before death occurred.

hardy_scale.description: Value on 4-point Hardy scale cause of death classification.
hardy_scale.guidelines: Enter: 0 for ventilator case, 1 for violent and fast death, 2 for fast death of natural causes, 3 for intermediate death, or 4 for slow death.

time_of_death.description: Date and time when death was declared.
time_of_death.guidelines: Enter the time in date-time format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ. Supplying partial date is allowed.

organ_donation_death_type.description: Type of death preceding organ donation.
organ_donation_death_type.example: Should be one of: Donation after circulatory death (DCD), or Donation after brainstem death (DBD).
organ_donation_death_type.guidelines: Enter value for organ donors only.

normothermic_regional_perfusion.description: Whether entire body was perfused with warm oxygenated blood.
normothermic_regional_perfusion.example: Should be one of: yes, no, or unknown.
normothermic_regional_perfusion.guidelines: Enter yes if entire body (but not limbs) was perfused with warm oxygenated blood. Otherwise, enter no.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: Information about other organisms that this organism is related to.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Familial relationship
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: familial_relationship

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

parent.guidelines: Enter the ID of the parent of this individual.

child.guidelines: Enter the ID of the child of this individual.

sibling.guidelines: Enter the ID of the sibling of this individual.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: Information about the medical history of a donor.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Medical history
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: medical_history

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

alcohol_history.description: Estimated amount of alcohol consumed per day.
alcohol_history.guidelines: Enter the amount consumed per day using units such as alcohol units (10mL or 8g of alcohol) or drinks (14g of alcohol).

medication.description: Medications the individual was taking at time of biomaterial collection.
medication.guidelines: Enter the medication and dosage. Separate multiple medications with commas.

smoking_history.description: Estimated number of cigarettes smoked per day.
smoking_history.guidelines: Enter an estimated number of cigarettes smoked per day and for how many years.

nutritional_state.description: Nutritional state of individual at time of biomaterial collection.
nutritional_state.example: Should be one of: normal, fasting, or feeding tube removed.

test_results.description: Results from medical tests performed on the individual.
test_results.example: lipid panel shows normal level of LDL (124 mg/dL); HIV, HBV, HCV: Negative

treatment.description: Treatments the individual has undergone prior to biomaterial collection.
treatment.example: Patient treated with antibiotics for a urinary tract infection; Patient treated with chemotherapy (Epirubicin, cisplatin, capecitabine) to treat stomach cancer

value.description: The numerical value in Timecourse unit associated with a time interval used in the experiment.
value.guidelines: Enter either a single value or a range of values. Indicate a range using a hyphen.

unit.description: The unit in which the Timecourse value is expressed.

relevance.description: Relevance of the Timecourse value/unit to the experiment.
relevance.example: Collection after tumor cells injected into the mammary gland; Time tissue underwent liberase digestion

https://schema.humancellatlas.org/type/p.name: process

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

schema_type.description: The type of the metadata schema entity.

provenance.description: Provenance information provided by the system.

start_time.description: Date and time the process started.
start_time.guidelines: Enter the time in date-time format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ.

end_time.description: Date and time the process ended.
end_time.guidelines: Enter the time in date-time format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ.

length_of_time.description: Length of time the process took to execute in Length of time unit.
length_of_time.guidelines: Enter a single value or a range of values separated by a hyphen.

length_of_time_unit.description: The unit in which Length of time is expressed.

deviation_from_protocol.description: A deviation from the protocol provided.
deviation_from_protocol.example: Skipped ACK lysis step; Used 100um filter instead of 40um filter

insdc_experiment.description: An International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC) experiment accession.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

file_name.guidelines: Include the file extension in the file name.

format.guidelines: Indicate the full file extension including compression extensions.

content_description.description: General description of the contents of the file.

file_source.description: The source of the file. This is typically an organisation, repository, person or dedicated process.
file_source.guidelines: Should be one of: DCP/2 Analysis, Contributor, ArrayExpress, HCA Release, GEO, SCEA, SCP, DCP/1 Matrix Service, LungMAP, Zenodo, Publication, DCP/2 Ingest

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: Information about the specimen that was collected from the donor organism.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: specimen_from_organism

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

schema_type.description: The type of the metadata schema entity.

provenance.description: Provenance information provided by the system.

genus_species.description: The scientific binomial name for the species of the specimen.

organ.description: The organ that the biomaterial came from.
organ.guidelines: Blood and connective tissue are considered organs.

organ_parts.description: A term for a specific part of the organ that the biomaterial came from.
organ_parts.guidelines: The term organ part is very broadly defined here.

diseases.description: Short description of known disease(s) of the specimen.
diseases.guidelines: Enter normal if no known diseases.

state_of_specimen.description: State of the specimen at the time of collection.

preservation_storage.description: Information about how a specimen was preserved and/or stored over a period of time.

collection_time.guidelines: Enter the time in date-time format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ssZ. Supplying partial date is allowed.

text.description: The text for the term as the user provides it.

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession.

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: A term that may be associated with an anatomy-related ontology term.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Organ part ontology
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: organ_part_ontology

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

text.description: The text for the term as the user provides it.

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession.

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: State of specimen at time of collection.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: State of specimen
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: state_of_specimen

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

autolysis_score.description: State of tissue breakdown due to self-digestion.
autolysis_score.example: Should be one of: none, mild, or moderate.

gross_description.description: Color, size, and other aspects of specimen as visible to naked eye.
gross_description.example: focal wedge shaped region of tan-orange discoloration; cystic

gross_images.description: List of filenames of photographs of specimen without magnification.
gross_images.guidelines: File must be of format JPEG, TIFF, or PNG.

ischemic_temperature.description: Whether specimen experienced warm or cold ischemia.
ischemic_temperature.example: Should be one of: warm, or cold.

ischemic_time.description: Duration of time, in seconds, between when the specimen stopped receiving oxygen and when it was preserved or processed.

microscopic_description.description: How the specimen looks under the microscope and how it compares with normal cells.
microscopic_description.example: Mixture of different cell sizes apparent; Dead cells are quite faint on microscope

microscopic_images.description: List of filenames of photographs of specimen under microscope.
microscopic_images.guidelines: File must be of format JPEG, TIFF, or PNG.

postmortem_interval.description: Duration of time between when death was declared and when the specimen was preserved or processed.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: Information relating to how a biomaterial was preserved and/or stored over a period of time.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Preservation and storage
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: preservation_storage

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

storage_method.description: The method by which a biomaterial was stored after preservation or before another protocol was used.

storage_time.description: Length of time the biomaterial was stored for in Storage time units.

storage_time_unit.description: The unit in which Storage time is expressed.

preservation_method.description: The method by which a biomaterial was preserved through the use of chemicals, cold, or other means to prevent or retard biological or physical deterioration.
enum: cryopreservation of live cells in liquid nitrogen
preservation_method.example: cryopreservation in liquid nitrogen (dead tissue); fresh

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: Information describing purchased kits or reagents used in a protocol.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Purchased reagents
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: purchased_reagents

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

retail_name.description: The retail name of the kit/reagent.
retail_name.example: SureCell WTA 3' Library Prep Kit; CytoTune iPS 2.0 Sendai Reprogramming Kit

catalog_number.description: The catalog number of the kit/reagent.

lot_number.description: The batch or lot number of the kit/reagent.

expiry_date.description: The date of expiration for the kit/reagent.
expiry_date.guidelines: Enter the date in date format: yyyy-mm-dd. Supplying partial date is allowed.

kit_titer.description: Appropriate titer and volume recommendations found in kit/reagent Certificate of Analysis.

https://schema.humancellatlas.org/type/b.description: Information about the suspension of cells or nuclei derived from the collected or cultured specimen.
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/type/b.title: Cell suspension
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/type/b.name: cell_suspension

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

schema_type.description: The type of the metadata schema entity.

provenance.description: Provenance information provided by the system.

cell_morphology.description: Features relating to the morphology of cells in a biomaterial.

growth_conditions.description: Features relating to the growth and/or maintenance of a biomaterial.

genus_species.description: The scientific binomial name for the species of the suspension.

selected_cell_types.description: The cell type(s) selected to be present in the suspension.
selected_cell_types.guidelines: Enter the cell type(s) selected for, not the cell type(s) determined to be present post-analysis.

estimated_cell_count.description: Estimated number of cells in the suspension.

plate_based_sequencing.description: Fields specific for plate-based sequencing experiments.

timecourse.description: Information relating to a timecourse associated with this cell suspension.

https://schema.humancellatlas.org/core/b.description: Information about any biological material that was generated/used in the project including everything from a whole organism to subcellular components.
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/core/b.title: Biomaterial core
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/core/b.name: biomaterial_core

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

biomaterial_id.description: A unique ID for the biomaterial.

biomaterial_name.description: A short, descriptive name for the biomaterial that need not be unique.

biomaterial_description.description: A general description of the biomaterial.

supplementary_files.description: A list of filenames of biomaterial-level supplementary files.

biosamples_accession.guidelines: Enter accession if sample has been archived. Accession can be from the DDBJ, NCBI, or EMBL-EBI and must start with SAMD, SAMN, or SAME, respectively.

insdc_sample_accession.description: An International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC) sample accession.
insdc_sample_accession.guidelines: Enter accession if sample has been archived. Accession can be from the DDBJ, NCBI, or EMBL-EBI and must start with DRS, SRS, or ERS, respecitvely.

HDBR_accession.description: A Human Developmental Biology Resource (HDBR) sample accession.
HDBR_accession.guidelines: Enter accession if sample has been obtained from the Human Developmental Biology Resource (HDBR).

https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.description: Information relating to pathological and morphological features of cells.
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.title: Cell morphology
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.name: cell_morphology

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

cell_morphology.description: General description of the morphology of cells.
cell_morphology.example: adherent cells; form single layer colonies

cell_size.description: Size of cells in Cell size unit.
cell_size.guidelines: Enter a single value or a range. Average value is acceptable.

cell_size_unit.description: The unit in which the Cell size is expressed.

percent_cell_viability.description: Percent of cells determined to be viable.
percent_cell_viability.guidelines: Enter a single number. Average value is acceptable.

cell_viability_method.description: The method by which cell viability was determined.

cell_viability_result.description: Result of the cell viability test.
cell_viability_result.example: Should be one of: pass, fail

percent_necrosis.description: Percent of cells identified to be necrotic.
percent_necrosis.guidelines: Enter a single number. Average value is acceptable.

https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.description: A term that may be associated with a cell type-related ontology term.
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.title: Length unit ontology
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.name: length_unit_ontology

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

text.description: The name of a length unit being used.

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession.

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field.

https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.description: Information relating to how a biomaterial was grown and/or maintained in a laboratory setting.
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.title: Growth conditions
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.name: growth_conditions

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

passage_number.description: The number of passages that the biomaterial has been through.

growth_medium.description: The solid, liquid, or semi-solid medium used to support growth.
growth_medium.example: human placental cord serum; RPMI 1640 + 2mM Glutamine + 10-20% FBS

culture_environment.description: Cell culture environment in which cells are grown.
culture_environment.example: Adherent cell culture; Suspension cell culture

mycoplasma_testing_method.description: The method by which the biomaterial was tested for mycoplasma contamination.
mycoplasma_testing_method.example: Should be one of: Direct DNA stain, Indirect DNA stain, Broth and agar culture, PCR, Nested PCR, ELISA, Autoradiography, Immunostaining, Cell-based assay, or Microbiological assay.

mycoplasma_testing_results.description: Whether the biomaterial passed or failed the mycoplasma test.
mycoplasma_testing_results.example: Should be one of: pass, or fail.

drug_treatment.description: Description of drugs added to the growth medium.
drug_treatment.guidelines: Provide the drug name and concentration with units. List multiple drugs separated by commas.

feeder_layer_type.description: Type of feeder layer cells on which biomaterial was grown.
enum: feeder-dependent, mouse bone marrow stromal cells
feeder-dependent, mouse yolk sac-derived endothelial cells
feeder-dependent, human fetal lung fibroblast cells
feeder-dependent, human umbilical cord stromal cells
feeder-dependent, human fetal liver stromal cells
feeder-dependent, human fallopian tubal epithelial cells
feeder_layer_type.example: feeder-free; feeder-dependent, mouse embryonic fibroblast cells

https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.description: A term that may be associated with a species-related ontology term.
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.title: Species ontology
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.name: species_ontology

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

text.description: The name of the species to which the organism belongs.

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession.

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field.

https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.description: A term that may be associated with a cell type-related ontology term.
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.title: Cell type ontology
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.name: cell_type_ontology

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: Version number in major.minor.patch format.

text.description: The name of a cell type supplied by a user.
text.example: bone marrow hematopoietic cell; cardiac muscle cell

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession.

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field.
ontology_label.example: bone marrow hematopoietic cell; cardiac muscle cell

https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.description: Information specific to plate-based sequencing experiments.
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.title: Plate-based sequencing
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.name: plate_based_sequencing

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

plate_label.description: A label or name for the plate on which the well is located.
plate_label.guidelines: Plate label should be unique in the project.

well_label.description: A label or name for the well in which the cell is located.
well_label.guidelines: Well label should be unique for the plate.

well_quality.description: Quality of well if imaged before sequencing.
well_quality.example: Should be one of: 'OK', 'control, 2-cell well', 'control, empty well', or 'low quality cell'.

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

value.description: The numerical value in Timecourse unit associated with a time interval used in the experiment.
value.guidelines: Enter either a single value or a range of values. Indicate a range using a hyphen.

unit.description: The unit in which the Timecourse value is expressed.

relevance.description: Relevance of the Timecourse value/unit to the experiment.
relevance.example: Collection after tumor cells injected into the mammary gland; Time tissue underwent liberase digestion

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: Information about the analysis protocol.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Analysis protocol
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: analysis_protocol

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

schema_type.description: The type of the metadata schema entity.

provenance.description: Provenance information provided by the system.

computational_method.description: A URI to a versioned workflow and versioned execution environment in a GA4GH-compliant repository.

matrix.description: Information related to protocols that output a matrix.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: Information about an intended protocol that was followed in the project.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Protocol core
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: protocol_core

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

protocol_id.description: A unique ID for the protocol.
protocol_id.guidelines: Protocol ID should have no spaces.

protocol_name.description: A short name for the protocol.

protocol_description.description: A general description of the protocol.

publication_doi.description: The publication digital object identifier (doi) for the protocol.

protocols_io_doi.description: The protocols.io digital object identifier (doi) for the protocol.

document.description: A filename of a PDF document containing the details of the protocol.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: A term that may be associated with a process-related ontology term.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Process type ontology
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: process_type_ontology

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

text.description: The name of a process type being used.

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession.

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: Information relating to generation of matrices
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Matrix
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: matrix

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

data_normalization_methods.description: Method(s) used to normalize data in the matrix

enum: RPKM (reads per kilobase of exon per million reads mapped)
FPKM (fragments per kilobase of exon per million fragments mapped)
TMM (EdgeR's trimmed mean of M values)

data_normalization_methods.guidelines: Should be one of: CPM (counts per million), TPM (transcripts per kilobase million), RPKM(reads per kilobase of exon per million reads mapped), FPKM (fragments per kilobase of exon per million fragments mapped), DESeq2’s median of ratios, TMM (EdgeR’s trimmed mean of M values), SF (size factor), UQ (Upper quartile), Downsampling, unknown, other.

derivation_process.description: Type of computational tool used in generating the matrix object.
derivation_process.guidelines: Should be one of: alignment, quantification, peak calling, peak annotation, gene filtering, cell filtering, merging, cell calling, ambient RNA correction, doublet removal, batch correction, depth normalization, other.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: Information about how a sequencing library was prepared.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Library preparation protocol
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: library_preparation_protocol

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

schema_type.description: The type of the metadata schema entity.

provenance.description: Provenance information provided by the system.

input_nucleic_acid_molecule.description: Starting nucleic acid molecule isolated for sequencing.

nucleic_acid_source.description: Source cells or organelles from which nucleic acid molecules were collected.
nucleic_acid_source.example: Should be one of: single cell, bulk cell, single nucleus, bulk nuclei, or mitochondria.

library_construction_method.description: The general method for sequencing library construction.

library_construction_kit.description: Name of kit used to construct the sequencing library.

nucleic_acid_conversion_kit.description: Name of kit used to convert RNA to DNA for sequencing.

end_bias.description: The type of tag or end bias the library has.
end_bias.example: Should be one of: 3 prime tag, 3 prime end bias, 5 prime tag, 5 prime end bias, or full length.
end_bias.guidelines: Enter 'full length' if there is no tag or end bias.

primer.description: Primer used for cDNA synthesis from RNA.
primer.example: Should be one of: poly-dT, or random.

strand.example: Should be one of: first, second, unstranded, or not provided.
strand.guidelines: Enter 'first' if sequenced molecule is only the strand generated during first strand synthesis. Enter 'second' if sequenced molecule is only the strand generated during second strand synthesis. Enter 'unstranded' if both strands were sequenced.

umi_barcode.description: Information about unique molecular identifier (UMI) barcodes.

library_preamplification_method.description: The method used to amplify RNA prior to adaptor ligation.

cdna_library_amplification_method.description: The method used to amplify cDNA library prior to sequencing.

nominal_length.description: Average (insert) size of the fragments being sequenced.

nominal_sdev.description: Standard deviation of the (insert) size of the fragments being sequenced.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: Information about barcodes used in a protocol.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Barcode
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: barcode

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

barcode_read.description: The read in which the barcode is found.
barcode_read.example: Should be one of: Read 1, Read 2, i7 Index, or i5 Index.

barcode_offset.description: The 0-based offset of start of barcode in read.

white_list_file.description: Name of file containing legitimate barcode sequences.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: A term that may be associated with a biological macromolecule-related ontology term.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Biological macromolecule ontology
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: biological_macromolecule_ontology

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

text.description: The name of the biological macromolecule being used.

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession.

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: A term that may be associated with a process-related ontology term.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Library construction ontology
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: library_construction_ontology

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

text.description: The name of a library construction approach being used.

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession.

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: A term that may be associated with a process-related ontology term.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Library amplification ontology
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: library_amplification_ontology

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

text.description: The name of a library amplification approach being used.

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession.

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: A project entity contains information about the overall project.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Project
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: project

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

schema_type.description: The type of the metadata schema entity.

provenance.description: Provenance information provided by the system.

contributors.description: People contributing to any aspect of the project.

supplementary_links.description: External link(s) pointing to code, supplementary data files, or analysis files associated with the project which will not be uploaded.

insdc_project_accessions.description: An International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC) project accession.
insdc_project_accessions.guidelines: Enter accession if project has been archived. Accession can be from the DDBJ, NCBI, or EMBL-EBI and must start with DRP, SRP, or ERP, respectively.

ega_accessions.description: A list of accessions referring to EGA (European Genome-Phenome Archive) datasets or studies.
ega_accessions.guidelines: Enter any EGA study or dataset accessions that relate to the project. Should start with EGAD or EGAS, study accession preferred.

dbgap_accessions.description: A list of database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) study accessions.
dbgap_accessions.guidelines: Enter any dbGaP study accessions that relate to this project. Should start with phs, can contain the specific version information.

geo_series_accessions.description: A Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO) series accession.
geo_series_accessions.guidelines: Enter accession if project has been archived. Accession must start with GSE.

array_express_accessions.guidelines: Enter accession if project has been archived. Accession must start with E-.

insdc_study_accessions.description: An International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC) study accession.
insdc_study_accessions.guidelines: Enter accession if study has been archived. Accession can be from the DDBJ, NCBI, or EMBL-EBI and must start with PRJD, PRJN, or PRJE, respectively.

biostudies_accessions.guidelines: Enter accession if study has been archived.

estimated_cell_count.description: An estimated number of cells in this project

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: Information about the project.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Project core
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: project_core

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

project_short_name.description: A short name for the project.
project_short_name.guidelines: Project label is a short label by which you refer to the project. It should have no spaces and should be fewer than 50 characters.

project_title.description: An official title for the project.
project_title.example: Study of single cells in the human body.
project_title.guidelines: Project title should be fewer than 30 words, such as a title of a grant proposal or a publication.

project_description.description: A longer description of the project which includes research goals and experimental approach.
project_description.guidelines: Project description should be fewer than 300 words, such as an abstract from a grant application or publication.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: Information about an individual who submitted or contributed to a project.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Contact
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: contact

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

name.description: Name of individual who has contributed to the project.
name.guidelines: Enter in the format: first name,middle name or initial,last name.

phone.description: Phone number of the individual or their lab.

institution.description: Name of primary institute where the individual works.

laboratory.description: Name of lab or department within the institute where the individual works.
laboratory.example: Division of Vaccine Discovery; Department of Biology

address.description: Street address where the individual works.
address.guidelines: Include street name and number, city, country division, and postal code.

corresponding_contributor.description: Whether the individual is a primary point of contact for the project.
corresponding_contributor.example: Should be one of: yes, or no.

project_role.description: Primary role of the individual in the project.

orcid_id.description: The individual's ORCID ID linked to previous work.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: A term that describes the role of a contributor in the project.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Contributor role ontology
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: contributor_role_ontology

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: Version number in major.minor.patch format.

text.description: The primary role of the contributor in the project.

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession.

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: Information about a journal article, book, web page, or other external available documentation for a project.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Publication
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: publication

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

authors.description: A list of authors associated with the publication.
authors.guidelines: List each author in 'surname initials' format.

title.example: Study of single cells in the human body.

doi.description: The publication digital object identifier (doi) of the publication.

pmid.description: The PubMed ID of the publication.

official_hca_publication.description: Has the publication been accepted as an official HCA publication, according to the process described in https://www.humancellatlas.org/publications/ ?
official_hca_publication.guidelines: Should be one of: yes, or no.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: Information about the project funding source.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Funder
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: funder

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

grant_title.description: The name of the grant funding the project.
grant_title.example: Study of single cells in the human body.
grant_title.guidelines: Enter a title of approximately 30 words.

grant_id.description: The unique grant identifier or reference.

organization.description: The name of the funding organization.
organization.example: Biotechnology and Biological Sciences Research Council (BBSRC); California Institute of Regenerative Medicine (CIRM)

https://schema.humancellatlas.org/type/p.description: Information about the biomaterial collection protocol.
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/type/p.title: Collection protocol
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/type/p.name: collection_protocol

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

schema_type.description: The type of the metadata schema entity.

provenance.description: Provenance information provided by the system.

method.description: Method used to collect the biomaterial.

reagents.description: A list of purchased reagents used in this protocol.

https://schema.humancellatlas.org/core/p.description: Information about an intended protocol that was followed in the project.
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/core/p.title: Protocol core
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/core/p.name: protocol_core

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

protocol_id.description: A unique ID for the protocol.
protocol_id.guidelines: Protocol ID should have no spaces.

protocol_name.description: A short name for the protocol.

protocol_description.description: A general description of the protocol.

publication_doi.description: The publication digital object identifier (doi) for the protocol.

protocols_io_doi.description: The protocols.io digital object identifier (doi) for the protocol.

document.description: A filename of a PDF document containing the details of the protocol.

https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.description: Information describing purchased kits or reagents used in a protocol.
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.title: Purchased reagents
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.name: purchased_reagents

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

retail_name.description: The retail name of the kit/reagent.
retail_name.example: SureCell WTA 3' Library Prep Kit; CytoTune iPS 2.0 Sendai Reprogramming Kit

catalog_number.description: The catalog number of the kit/reagent.

lot_number.description: The batch or lot number of the kit/reagent.

expiry_date.description: The date of expiration for the kit/reagent.
expiry_date.guidelines: Enter the date in date format: yyyy-mm-dd. Supplying partial date is allowed.

kit_titer.description: Appropriate titer and volume recommendations found in kit/reagent Certificate of Analysis.

https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.description: A file of read sequences generated by a sequencing experiment.
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.title: Sequence file
https://schema.staging.data.humancellatl.name: sequence_file

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

schema_type.description: The type of the metadata schema entity.

provenance.description: Provenance information provided by the system.

read_index.description: The sequencing read this file represents.
read_index.example: Should be one of: read1, read2, index1, index2
read_index.guidelines: If a sequencing experiment is single-end, enter 'read1'.

lane_index.description: The lane that this file was sequenced from.

read_length.description: The length of a sequenced read in this file, in nucleotides.

insdc_run_accessions.description: An International Nucleotide Sequence Database Collaboration (INSDC) run accession.
insdc_run_accessions.guidelines: Enter accession if run has been archived. Accession can be from the DDBJ, NCBI, or EMBL-EBI and must start with DRR, SRR, or ERR, respectively.

library_prep_id.description: A unique ID for the library preparation.
library_prep_id.guidelines: Indicate which samples are from the same library preparation by providing a unique identifier for each library preparation.

https://schema.humancellatlas.org/type/p.description: Information about how a biomaterial is enriched for a feature or characteristic of interest.
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/type/p.title: Enrichment protocol
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/type/p.name: enrichment_protocol

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

schema_type.description: The type of the metadata schema entity.

provenance.description: Provenance information provided by the system.

method.description: The method by which enrichment was achieved.

markers.description: A list of markers used to enrich for or against certain cells.
markers.guidelines: Format as a space-delimited list of markers with +/- where + means enriched for and - means enriched against.

minimum_size.description: Minimum cell or organelle size passing selection, in microns.

maximum_size.description: Maximum cell or organelle size passing selection, in microns.

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

schema_type.description: The type of the metadata schema entity.

provenance.description: Provenance information provided by the system.

instrument_manufacturer_model.description: The manufacturer and model of the sequencer.

local_machine_name.description: Local name for the particular machine used for sequencing.

paired_end.description: Whether the sequenced molecule was sequenced from both ends.
paired_end.example: Should be one of: yes, or no.
paired_end.guidelines: If 3' 10x v2 was used, enter no.

https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.description: A term that may be associated with a instrument-related ontology term.
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.title: Instrument ontology
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.name: instrument_ontology

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: Version number in major.minor.patch format.

text.description: The full name of the instrument used.

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession.

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field.

https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.description: A term that may be associated with a process-related ontology term.
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.title: Sequencing ontology
https://schema.humancellatlas.org/module.name: sequencing_ontology

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

text.description: The name of a sequencing approach being used.
text.example: tag based single cell RNA sequencing; full length single cell RNA sequencing

ontology.description: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession.

ontology_label.description: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field.
ontology_label.example: tag based single cell RNA sequencing; full length single cell RNA sequencing

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

fastq_method.description: Method used for the generation of fastq files from bcl files.

fastq_method_version.description: Version of the program used for fastq generation.

pooled_channels.description: The number of channels pooled within a sequencing lane.

drop_uniformity.description: Whether drop uniformity was achieved as a result of visual inspection of emulsion after a 10x run.
drop_uniformity.example: Should be one of: yes, or no.
